itemselectr 0.1
  • Reference

Rasch analysis of dichotomous or polytomous items

Simple.Rasch.Rd

Basic Rasch analysis of dichotomous or polytomous items. This function is a wrapper of the tam.mml() function of the TAM package and of the principal() function of the psych package. The purpose of the function is to simplify the Rasch analysis process and to produce the output and plots that applied and beginner users most typically want.

Usage

Simple.Rasch(raschdata, irtmodel)

Arguments

raschdata

A data frame containing items where the lowest response category is scored as 0

irtmodel

The Rasch model, which can be "PCM", "PCM2" or "RSM".

Value

The output is a list containing the results of the analysis.

See also

TAM::tam.mml() and psych::principal(), which this function wraps.

Examples

library(TAM)
library(lordif)
data(Anxiety)
Anxiety <- Anxiety - 1

## Fit the rating scale model
myoutput <- Simple.Rasch(raschdata = Anxiety[4:32], irtmodel = "RSM")
